description: Variation of Condition Application under Section 73A of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 to carry out development without compliance with Condition 4 (Operation Hours) of planning permission 22/01977/FUL (Change of Use of Unit 1 41B Old London Road to Cafe/Deli (Use Classes Order - Class E(b)) to allow change in opening time.
decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of the planning permission ref. no  22/01977/FUL granted on 15.06.2022.Reason: This is required by Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

Notwithstanding Section 55 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended) and the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended) (or any Order revoking and reenacting that Order with or without modification), the premises shall only be used for the purposes specified in the application documents, a Cafe (Use Class E(b)), and for no other purposes whatsoever including any other purposes falling within Use Class E of the Schedule to the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987 (or any provision equivalent to that class in any Order revoking and reenacting that Order with or without modification).Reason: The acceptability of the development is highly dependent upon the exact nature of the use of the site and other uses, whether within the same use class or permitted by the General Permitted Development Order, are unlikely to be acceptable in planning terms.

The use hereby permitted shall only take place between the hours of 07.00 and 21.00 Monday to Sunday (including bank holidays). Customers shall vacate the premises 30 mins after closing time. Staff shall be allowed access to and able to use the premises within the building 1 hour before opening and 1 hour after closing, (i.e. between the hours 06.00 and 22.00 Monday to Sunday (including bank holidays). Reason: To ensure satisfactory living conditions for neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with policy D3 of the London Plan 2021 and policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

The rating level of the noise determined by the cumulative sound emissions of the plant to which this permission relates shall be at least 5dBA lower than the existing background noise level at any given time of operation. The noise levels shall be measured or predicted 1m externally to any window at the nearest residential facade and the measurements and assessment shall be made according to BS 4142:2014.Reason: To ensure satisfactory living conditions for neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with policy D14 of the London Plan 2021 policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

The premises shall not be used for the sale of food for consumption off the premises.Reason: To satisfactorily protect the character and appearance of the area and the residential amenities of nearby occupiers policy D14 of the London Plan 2021 policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.
